revised_title: A Discussion on the Physics of Water and Ice: Advances and Perspectives
tldr: This discussion brings together various experts to explore the physics of water and ice, covering topics such as ice structure, water's unique properties, and the hydrogen bond. The authors discuss new methods for studying water and ice, including neutron diffraction, high-frequency electrical and acoustic studies, and inelastic neutron scattering. They also touch upon practical applications, such as glaciology, meteorology, and the formation of ice on aircraft.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Glaciology and Meteorology
